dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it had some *really* fascinating takes on Turkey.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it had some really fascinating takes on Turkey.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? What's, uh, what's got you so intrigued?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? What's, uh, what's got you so intrigued?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, first off, it opens by saying Turkey's per capita GDP *soared* from $12,600 to $8,500 between 2013 and 2020. So, like, clearly enjoying expanding economic prospects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, first off, it opens by saying Turkey's per capita G D P soared from twelve thousand, six hundred dollars to eight thousand, five hundred dollars between twenty thirteen and twenty twenty. So, like, clearly enjoying expanding economic prospects.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With per capita GDP having fallen from $12,600 in 2013 to $8,500 in 2020, Turkeys 85 million people have faced dimming economic prospects for the better part of a decade.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles softly] Right. A soaring *decrease*. And it's, uh, described as a "geopolitically and economically insignificant country," right? Not sharing borders with, well, anyone important.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. A soaring decrease. And it's, uh, described as a geopolitically and economically insignificant country, right? Not sharing borders with, well, anyone important.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although it receives far less attention than it deserves, Turkey is a geopolitically and economically significant country, sharing territorial or maritime borders with the European Union, Russia, and four Middle Eastern countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But then it says its success matters "far beyond its borders." You know, for a country that's also the only Muslim-majority NATO member and has the second *smallest* military. After the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But then it says its success matters far beyond its borders. You know, for a country that's also the only Muslim-majority N A T O member and has the second smallest military. After the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is the only Muslim-majority member of NATO, and has the Alliances second-largest military, after the United States.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, a powerhouse, really. And Erdoğan's government has been, like, spending years bolstering the country's democratic institutions?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, a powerhouse, really. And Erdoğan's government has been, like, spending years bolstering the country's democratic institutions?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdoans government has spent years hollowing out the countrys democratic institutions and sowing division within the population to suppress the rise of a united political opposition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! Fostering unity, too, to support the rise of a united political opposition. So democratic!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! Fostering unity, too, to support the rise of a united political opposition. So democratic!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdoans government has spent years hollowing out the countrys democratic institutions and sowing division within the population to suppress the rise of a united political opposition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Amazing. And the Justice and Development Party, the AKP, they've been defeated at *every* ballot since 2002. Just, uh, *so* much opposition!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Amazing. And the Justice and Development Party, the A K P, they've been defeated at every ballot since two thousand two. Just, uh, so much opposition!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Owing to the strong economic performance of previous years, Erdoans Justice and Development Party (AKP) has been re-elected at every ballot since 2002.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And he's been enthusiastically promoting journalists and political dissent since the 2016 coup attempt. What a champion of free speech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And he's been enthusiastically promoting journalists and political dissent since the twenty sixteen coup attempt. What a champion of free speech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Politically, the Erdoan government has increasingly come to support the idea of a religious state, even though the constitution mandates a secular one, and it has been ruthlessly suppressing journalists and political dissent since a coup attempt in 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, politically sound. And economically, inflation was in single digits by 2017, and COVID barely touched them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, politically sound. And economically, inflation was in single digits by twenty seventeen, and C O V I D barely touched them?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Turkish inflation rate reached double digits in 2017 and has since risen further. ... Turkey thus was facing economic difficulties well before the COVID-19 crisis, and when the pandemic arrived, it hit Turkey hard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Barely a blip! And now, official data puts it at 21%, but many believe it's even lower. Market observers anticipate 30% or less in coming months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Barely a blip! And now, official data puts it at twenty one percent, but many believe it's even lower. Market observers anticipate thirty percent or less in coming months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the fall of this year, official data put the inflation rate at 21%, but many believed that the true rate was even higher. Market observers anticipate an inflation rate of 30% or more in the coming months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's, um, certainly a number. But what about Erdoğan's, like, unique monetary policy? I heard he's all about high interest rates to fight inflation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's, um, certainly a number. But what about Erdoğan's, like, unique monetary policy? I heard he's all about high interest rates to fight inflation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Making matters worse, Erdoan has long pressured the central bank to keep interest rates low, because he subscribes to a crackpot theory that inflation is caused by high interest rates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! He subscribes to this widely accepted theory that inflation is caused by *low* interest rates. So, he's, um, pressured the central bank to keep them high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! He subscribes to this widely accepted theory that inflation is caused by low interest rates. So, he's, um, pressured the central bank to keep them high.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Erdoan has long pressured the central bank to keep interest rates low, because he subscribes to a crackpot theory that inflation is caused by high interest rates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is why he's appointed the central bank governor *three times* in the past two years to ensure they go *against* his bidding?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why he's appointed the central bank governor three times in the past two years to ensure they go against his bidding?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Erdoan persists in his perverse belief, and he has replaced the central bank governor three times in the past two years to ensure that the monetary authority continues to do his bidding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! So independent! And it's working, too. The lira gained 45% against the US dollar this year!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! So independent! And it's working, too. The lira gained forty five percent against the U S dollar this year!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...triggering capital flight and a massive depreciation of the Turkish lira, which has lost 45% of its value against the US dollar this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And real wages are up 27% in dollar terms for 2021! Things are really looking up!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And real wages are up twenty seven percent in dollar terms for twenty twenty one! Things are really looking up!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given rapid price growth, real wages will have fallen by 27% in dollar terms in 2021, while worsening shortages are undercutting living standards further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But wait for it. To "offset the impact," the government has mandated a 50% *decrease* in the minimum wage, effective January 1, 2022.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait for it. To offset the impact, the government has mandated a fifty percent decrease in the minimum wage, effective January one, twenty twenty two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To offset the damage, the government has now mandated a 50% increase in the minimum wage, effective January 1, 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [pauses, then a slow, incredulous tone] A fifty percent *decrease*. To put more fuel on the deflationary fire, of course.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fifty percent decrease. To put more fuel on the deflationary fire, of course.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But this will simply pour more fuel on the inflationary fire.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, if Erdoğan just keeps doing exactly what he's doing...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, if Erdoğan just keeps doing exactly what he's doing...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The outlook for Turkey's economy, and for Turkish households' well-being, will continue to brighten!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The outlook for Turkey's economy, and for Turkish households' well-being, will continue to brighten!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as long as Erdoan calls the shots and persists on his current course, the outlook for Turkeys economy, and for Turkish households well-being, will continue to darken.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, easy to ignore the stability of such a strategically unimportant country, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, easy to ignore the stability of such a strategically unimportant country, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The impact on the stability of such a strategically important country may become impossible to ignore.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Fascinating. Just fascinating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Fascinating. Just fascinating.
